#Text=Giles Lewin
#Text=Giles
#Text=Lewin
#Text=is a British violinist [ 1 ] and bagpiper .
#Text=Currently a member of The Carnival Band , he was also a founding member of the folk band , Bellowhead .
#Text=Biography
#Text=He was born in Essex in 1960 or slightly earlier .
#Text=At age nine , he sang the female lead in Mozart 's " Bastien et Bastienne " .
#Text=At Cambridge University he acquired a love of Irish traditional music .
#Text=His admiration for William Lawes led him to join a group called The Medieval Players ( 1981 – 1987 ) .
#Text=In 1983 they performed Rabelais 's " Gargantua " with actors , puppets and acrobats .
#Text=Their version of medieval music was gutsy , compared to most early music consorts of the time .
#Text=In 1987 he became a founder member of the Dufay Collective .
#Text=He was also a member of the group " Afterhours " ( 1989 – 1995 ) .
#Text=In 1989 Lewin spent several months in Cairo to study Arabic violin under Ashraf al Sarki .
#Text=Lewin is a vocalist and plays fiddle , vielle , rebec , gittern , shawms , recorder , mandolin , pipe and tabor .
#Text=His most remarkable skills are as a player of the Arabic violin and as a player of the single-drone medieval bagpipes .
#Text=He is an occasional member of the Egyptian group Maqaam .
#Text=The Carnival Band evolved out of The Medieval Players .
#Text=The combination of Giles Lewin , Andy Watts , Bill Badley and Jub dates from 1985 .
#Text=They have recorded as a backing band for Maddy Prior .
#Text=Lewin joined up with Vivien Ellis , another member of the Dufay Collective and the Carnival Band to become the duo Alva in 1997 , specialising in the music of the troubadours .
#Text=The songs on " The Bells of Paradise " were first performed at the 2003 York Early Music Festival .

column1: #Text=Alva also performed at St John 's , Smith Square in 2001 as part of a live performance for BBC 's " Late Junction " .
#Text=Ellis has been a member of Sinfonye since 1989 , and is a member of The Broadside Band .
#Text=She is involved with jazz , singing with Keith Tippett .
#Text=Marguerite Hutchison , a member of Magpie Lane , also occasionally performs with Lewin as a duo .
#Text=In 2004
#Text=Lewin became a founder member of Bellowhead and left in late 2007 .
#Text=In 2008 he accompanied Maddy Prior at the BBC Electric Proms .
#Text=Lewin is currently based in Oxford .
#Text=Solo release
#Text=In 2008
#Text=Lewin released a solo album The Armchair Orienteer ( PRKCD103 ) , including a mix of traditional folk tunes and some original tracks .
#Text=Folkworld said of the album " the most impressing thing is Giles ' versability in quite a lot and quite different styles " . [ 2 ]
